The Senate just passed legislation I cosponsored to make sure government workers affected by the shutdown get back pay. The President should sign it immediately. Most importantly, he needs to act now and reopen the government.

It would be outrageous to divert U.S. Army Corps money from critical priorities for Michigan like the Soo Locks, dredging of our harbors, infrastructure for our ports and waterways, and plans to stop Asian carp from entering the Great Lakes. https://twitter.com/NBCInvestigates/status/1083478660471025664 …
None of this has to be happening. The President can easily end the #TrumpShutdown by signing the bipartisan government funding bills that have been passed by the House and Senate.
And beyond SNAP, school meals, support for women, infants, and children, and food for seniors are all at risk if this shutdown does not come to an end.

The #TrumpShutdown threatens the 38 million people who rely on SNAP to put food on the table, including many seniors, children, and people with disabilities. They should have long-term certainty that food assistance will be available.
It also means many routine food safety inspections have been halted https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/09/health/shutdown-fda-food-inspections.html …
The #TrumpShutdown means pollution inspectors aren’t on the job, potentially putting our health and safety at risk. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/09/climate/epa-pollution-inspection-shutdown.html …

Homeowners in small towns and rural communities can’t get the housing loans they need to pay their mortgages because the USDA Rural Development office is shut down. https://www.woodtv.com/news/national/homebuyers-in-limbo-as-shutdown-drags-on/1694614652 …

Local Farm Service offices are closed and farmers can’t apply for loans they need. Dairy farmers can't access additional support they received in the new Farm Bill. And farmers can't count on important crop reports to make decisions about the upcoming planting season.

Every day that USDA is shut down is another day that the improvements we made in the 2018 Farm Bill are delayed and the situation gets more serious for farmers and families. https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/already-reeling-from-tariff-war-farmers-arent-receiving-government-support-checks-amid-shutdown/2019/01/09/2403fca2-40a0-4cc2-8d9c-d4787edde1b4_story.html?utm_term=.76f2a9d43e61 …

The #TrumpShutdown could even hurt our country’s credit rating the longer it goes on, making it more expensive for families and companies to borrow money. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/01/09/fitch-warns-an-extended-shutdown-could-hurt-us-credit-rating/?utm_term=.f547dd00cb93 …

The #TrumpShutdown means many Michigan workers can’t pay their bills, some people have been forced to get temporary jobs, and small business owners are losing business because they depend on spending by federal employees.
In just two days, the #TrumpShutdown will become the longest government shutdown ever. Here are just a few examples of how it is hurting our country.
